hangman

Class ProcessData

  • java.lang.Object
    • hangman.ProcessData

  • public class ProcessData
extends java.lang.Object
    Processes the data based on the guesses of the program and the answers of the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProcessData() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int howManyLetters()
      Asks the user how many letters the word he's thinking of contains, returns that number.
      static int howManyWords(java.lang.String possibleWord)
      Method to know how many possible words there are, does this until there's only 1 word, or there's multiple word's and it guessed all the letters (so the words are anagrams).
      static java.lang.String letsGuess(java.lang.String possibleWord, int[] m, int[] guesses)
      Method to automatize the process of the game.
      static java.lang.String randomGuess(java.lang.String possibleWord)
      In case the words are Anagrams (words that contains the same number of letters, and all the same letters arranged in a different way, for example 'fluster' and 'restful'), it will guess the word randomly.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProcessData

        public ProcessData()

    • Method Detail

      • howManyLetters

        public static int howManyLetters()
        Asks the user how many letters the word he's thinking of contains, returns that number.
        Returns:
        Number of letters the word the user is thinking of and the program is gonna look for (needs to be bigger than 0).

      • letsGuess

        public static java.lang.String letsGuess(java.lang.String possibleWord,
                                         int[] m,
                                         int[] guesses)
        Method to automatize the process of the game.
        Parameters:
        possibleWord - All possible words the user may be thinking of.
        m - Vector of 26 spaces (again, 26 letters of the English alphabet), if the position v[0]=1, it means that we already guessed the letter 'a' and we cannot return that value (because we already guessed that letter), otherwise we can return that value.
        guesses - The number of CORRECT guesses the program can ask the user, because if the words contains 7 letters and it already guessed all corectly it won't keep asking (this is for the specific cases of anagrams, words of the same length with all the same letters arranged in a different order).
        Returns:
        All the possible words the user may thinking of.

      • randomGuess

        public static java.lang.String randomGuess(java.lang.String possibleWord)
        In case the words are Anagrams (words that contains the same number of letters, and all the same letters arranged in a different way, for example 'fluster' and 'restful'), it will guess the word randomly.
        Parameters:
        possibleWord - All possible words the user may be thinking of.
        Returns:
        A random word of all the possible ones.

      • howManyWords

        public static int howManyWords(java.lang.String possibleWord)
        Method to know how many possible words there are, does this until there's only 1 word, or there's multiple word's and it guessed all the letters (so the words are anagrams).
        Parameters:
        possibleWord - All the possible words that the user is thinking of.
        Returns:
        The number of possible words.
